block.comment: Get the latest details of the specified Jira
Ignore the "does not exist" error, stop the job for any other error

input.stop_reason: Specified Jira could not be found.

block.comment: If the Jira does not exist (or we don't have permission to it), stop the job now

block.name: search_sobjects
block.title: Search Jira- case associations
block.description: Search for Jira- case associations in Salesforce

extended_input_schema.name: include_combined_attachments
extended_input_schema.label: Select combined attachments
extended_input_schema.hint: Select Yes to obtain data from notes, attachments and files associated to the queried records. Default value is Yes.

block.comment: get all the jira case associations with the old Jira Issue Key

block.name: delete_sobject
block.title: Delete Jira- case association
block.description: Delete Jira- case association in Salesforce

extended_input_schema.name: id
extended_input_schema.label: Jira-Case Association ID
extended_input_schema.hint: Delete Jira-Case Association with this ID

block.comment: Delete the old association (SFDC throws a validation error of "You have already attached this Jira record to this Case." if you just try to update the existing jira-case association).

block.title: Accumulate items to New Jira Case Associations list
block.description: Accumulate items to New Jira Case Associations list

block.title: Accumulate items to Jira-Case Key Update Errors list
block.description: Accumulate items to Jira-Case Key Update Errors list

block.comment: Just log the error, but don't stop the recipe from running (in case the new project is not one of the options in the Jira-Case Asscociation project picklist)

block.name: search_sobjects
block.title: Search Jira issues
block.description: Search for Jira issues in Salesforce

extended_input_schema.name: include_combined_attachments
extended_input_schema.label: Select combined attachments
extended_input_schema.hint: Select Yes to obtain data from notes, attachments and files associated to the queried records. Default value is Yes.

block.comment: Get the Jira Issue object that is using the old key

block.name: delete_sobject
block.title: Delete Jira issue

extended_input_schema.name: id
extended_input_schema.label: Jira Issue ID
extended_input_schema.hint: Delete Jira Issue with this ID

block.comment: delete this Jira Issue since it is no longer valid

If the Jira redirects to a different Jira (if the Jira Key of the search result is different than the Jira Key specified in the Jira-Case Association), then update all the Jira-Case Associations with the new Jira Key

block.name: upsert_sobject
block.title: Upsert Jira issue

extended_input_schema.name: Name
extended_input_schema.label: Jira Number
extended_input_schema.hint: Search for  where Jira Number has this value. If a record already exists, it will be updated. Otherwise, a new record will be created

block.comment: Make sure SFDC has the latest Jira fields

block.name: search_entries
block.description: Search entries in JIRA_VARIABLES lookup table

extended_input_schema.name: parameters
extended_input_schema.label: Search by
extended_input_schema.hint: Provide one or more entry fields to search the entry

block.comment: See if the project is currently being monitored for changes in Jira

block.name: add_entry
block.description: Add entry to JIRA_VARIABLES lookup table

extended_input_schema.name: parameters
extended_input_schema.label: Entry fields
extended_input_schema.hint: Fill the fields for the new entry

block.comment: If the project is not being monitored, add it to the monitoring list so that when Jiras from this project are updated in Jira they will be synced to Salesforce.  This will prevent us from having to manually updating the lookup table every time a new project is added to the Case-Association object in Salesforce.

block.name: send_reply
block.description: Return response from Sync Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

extended_input_schema.name: code
extended_input_schema.label: Error code
extended_input_schema.hint: Use this field to set custom HTTP error code for service replies. E.g: 404/422 etc. This field is applicable to REST service recipes.

extended_input_schema.name: custom_error_response
extended_input_schema.label: Custom error response?
extended_input_schema.hint: By default, Workato sends 'reply_type' and 'message' fields in response. When set to 'Yes', the content of the 'Message' field is sent as response body. This field is applicable to REST service recipes.

toggle_field.label: Custom error response?
toggle_field.hint: By default, Workato sends 'reply_type' and 'message' fields in response. When set to 'Yes', the content of the 'Message' field is sent as response body. This field is applicable to REST service recipes.
toggle_field.name: custom_error_response

block.comment: Return a pretty error so debugging is easier from parent recipe
don't stop with error, because we would want to fix this problem from the parent recipe

block.name: send_reply
block.description: Return response from Sync Jira Issue to Salesforce Jira Issue

properties.name: remapped_jira_case_associations
properties.label: Remapped Jira/Case Associations
properties.hint: List of the remapped Jira Case Associations

properties.label: Jira Issue Key
properties.name: jira_issue_key
properties.hint: Key of the updated Jira, it will be blank if no Jira was updated

code.comment: This recipes does the following: 1.  Remap Jira-Case Associations if Jira has changed keys.  2.  Upsert the Jira Issue into Salesforce (cache Jira details in Salesforce).  3.  Add the project to the monitoring lookup table so that Workato will capture updates from this project and update Salesforce in the future.
